honey_nut_cheerios.heading: A delicious and nutritious cereal (Cheerios honey nut) for a bargain price.
honey_nut_cheerios.author: Joseph J. Truncale
honey_nut_cheerios.desc: It is fresh and delicious when eating it with a cup of milk. If you like Cheerios cereal you may want to try the honey nut variation. It has the just amount of sweetness to make it a pleasure to eat.

frosted_flakes.heading: Oh how I love thee, Tony the Tiger
frosted_flakes.author: Nicholas Bartolotta
frosted_flakes.desc: I've been eating these sugary corn flakes for 35+ years! Even though the boxes get smaller, they still pack a wholesome sugary kick and remind me of times of yesteryears when I used to eat them all the time...lunch, dinner, midnight snack. Ahh, those were the days. But hey, I'm an adult now. I can eat these whenever I want, STILL, and THEY'RE GR-R-REAT!

cinnamon_toast_crunch.heading: Oh how I love thee, Tony the Tiger
cinnamon_toast_crunch.author: Jackie Lee Tinnell Jr
cinnamon_toast_crunch.desc: I love anything with cinnamon normally and these are the best ever! Great flavor and great cinnamon taste!

froot_loops.heading: Love Froot Loops
froot_loops.author: Junellen
froot_loops.desc: I loved them as a child and still love them as an adult.

special_k.heading: Special K = Riboflavin +++
special_k.author: B C
special_k.desc: Special k is awesome. Good ingredients, good cereal, my kids eat it everyday. For years we have had a hard time getting our kids 100% of their daily recommended Riboflavin. In just one bowl of Special K there is 20% of their daily intake. What other cereal offer that?? My husband and I are very happy with the decision to buy special k. Riboflavin may not seem important, but has been proven that kids with a riboflavin deficiency do not do as well in school, and are more prone to substance abuse. Thank you Kelloggâ€™s and that you special k for making a quality product.

raisin_bran.heading: Yummy cereal
raisin_bran.author: RACER
raisin_bran.desc: These are so fresh and flavorful. Not only for breakfast-i found a muffin receipe using raisin bran. It is called six-week muffins. Makes a huge bowl of muffin mix. You can either make the muffins or leave in the bowl (refridgerated) and use as needed. Was a big hit in my family and neighborhood. Ready to make a second batch.
